channel.title: How do i add strings?
channel.description: So im suppose to add a string of newKiller and oldKiller into my player file can someone explain to me how do i add them?

item.title: How do i add strings?
item.dc:creator: @elite_expert elite expert
item.description:
@elite_expert wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:12, topic:527030”][quote author=elite expert link=topic=645778.msg4343450#msg4343450 date=1375489587]

Wow, you didn’t read the red bold letters…

MAKE SURE THE { } are correct and you aren’t messing them up!

ok now i read that and fixed that im now getting these errors

[code]src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1381: error: method applyDead() is
already defined in class PlayerAssistant
public void applyDead() {
^
src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1298: error: cannot find symbol
c.killerId = newKiller;
^
symbol: variable newKiller
location: class PlayerAssistant
src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1308: error: cannot find symbol
if (!PlayerKilling.hostOnList(o, connectedFrom) &&
^
symbol: variable connectedFrom
location: class PlayerAssistant
src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1312: error: cannot find symbol
if (newKiller == oldKiller) {
^
symbol: variable newKiller
location: class PlayerAssistant
src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1312: error: cannot find symbol
if (newKiller == oldKiller) {
^
symbol: variable oldKiller
location: class PlayerAssistant
src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1321: error: cannot find symbol
newKiller = oldKiller;
^
symbol: variable newKiller
location: class PlayerAssistant
src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1321: error: cannot find symbol
newKiller = oldKiller;
^
symbol: variable oldKiller
location: class PlayerAssistant
src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1341: error: variable o is already
defined in method applyDead()
Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
^
src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:77: error: cannot find symbol
p.lastConnectedFrom.add(token2);

                                             ^

symbol: variable lastConnectedFrom
location: variable p of type Client
src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:79: error: cannot find symbol
p.lastConnectedFrom.add(token2);

                                             ^

symbol: variable lastConnectedFrom
location: variable p of type Client
src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:233: error: no suitable method found for
write(String,int,String)
characterfile.write(p.newKiller, 0, p.newKiller);
^
method BufferedWriter.write(String,int,int) is not applicable
(actual argument String cannot be converted to int by method invocation co
nversion)

conversion)

write(String,int,String)
characterfile.write(p.oldKiller, 0, p.oldKiller);
^

(actual argument String cannot be converted to int by method invocation co
nversion)

conversion)

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
[/quote]

You probably copy pasted the applydeath method from somewhere without removing the original one.[/quote]
oh ha ha got that now im getting these

src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1327: error: <identifier> expected c.playerKilled = c.playerId; ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1328: error: illegal start of type if (o.duelStatus == 5) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1328: error: <identifier> expected if (o.duelStatus == 5) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1328: error: ';' expected if (o.duelStatus == 5) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1328: error: illegal start of type if (o.duelStatus == 5) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1328: error: <identifier> expected if (o.duelStatus == 5) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1328: error: ';' expected if (o.duelStatus == 5) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1329: error: illegal start of type o.duelStatus++; item.title: How do i add strings?
item.dc:creator: @elite_expert elite expert
item.description:
@elite_expert wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:527030”]Okay.
Player.java:
Declare:

public String newKiller;
public String oldKiller;

Playersave.java
Add:

					} else if(token.equals("newKiller")) {
						p.lastConnectedFrom.add(token2);
					} else if(token.equals("oldKiller")) {
						p.lastConnectedFrom.add(token2);
					}

That should go under p.playerRights
MAKE SURE THE { } are correct and you aren’t messing them up!
Then find:
characterfile.write("character-rights = ", 0, 19); (OR similar)
and add under the newLine():

characterfile.write("newKiller = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(p.newKiller, 0, p.newKiller); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("oldKiller = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(p.oldKiller, 0, p.oldKiller); characterfile.newLine(); [/quote]

Ok so i did that and got

src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:249: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.newLine(); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:250: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write("character-height = ", 0, 19); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:251: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.heightLevel), 0, Integer.toString(p.heightLevel).length()); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:252: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.newLine(); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:253: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write("character-posx = ", 0, 17); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:254: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.absX), 0, Integer .toString(p.absX).length()); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:257: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.absY), 0, Integer .toString(p.absY).length()); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:258: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.newLine(); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:259: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write("character-rights = ", 0, 19); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:260: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.playerRights), 0, Integer.toString(p.playerRights).length()); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:261: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.newLine(); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:262: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write("votePoints = ", 0, 13); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:263: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.votePoints), 0, I nteger.toString(p.votePoints).length()); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:264: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.newLine(); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:265: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write("don-points = ", 0, 13); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:266: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.donPoints), 0, In teger.toString(p.donPoints).length()); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:267: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected characterfile.newLine(); ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:268: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected for(int j = 0; j < p.lastKilledPlayers.size(); j++) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:268: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected for(int j = 0; j < p.lastKilledPlayers.size(); j++) { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerSave.java:268: error: class, interface, or enum ex pected for(int j = 0; item.title: How do i add strings?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Okay.
Player.java:
Declare:

public String newKiller;
public String oldKiller;

Playersave.java
Add:

					} else if(token.equals("newKiller")) {
						p.lastConnectedFrom.add(token2);
					} else if(token.equals("oldKiller")) {
						p.lastConnectedFrom.add(token2);
					}

That should go under p.playerRights
MAKE SURE THE { } are correct and you aren’t messing them up!
Then find:
characterfile.write("character-rights = ", 0, 19); (OR similar)
and add under the newLine():

				characterfile.write("newKiller = ", 0, 12);
				characterfile.write(p.newKiller, 0, p.newKiller);
				characterfile.newLine();
				characterfile.write("oldKiller = ", 0, 12);
				characterfile.write(p.oldKiller, 0, p.oldKiller);
				characterfile.newLine();

Read full topic

src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1381: error: method applyDead() is already defined in class PlayerAssistant public void applyDead() { ^ src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1298: error: cannot find symbol c.killerId = newKiller; ^ symbol: variable newKiller location: class PlayerAssistant src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1308: error: cannot find symbol if (!PlayerKilling.hostOnList(o, connectedFrom) && ^ symbol: variable connectedFrom location: class PlayerAssistant src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1312: error: cannot find symbol if (newKiller == oldKiller) { ^ symbol: variable newKiller location: class PlayerAssistant src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1312: error: cannot find symbol if (newKiller == oldKiller) { ^ symbol: variable oldKiller location: class PlayerAssistant src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1321: error: cannot find symbol newKiller = oldKiller; ^ symbol: variable newKiller location: class PlayerAssistant src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1321: error: cannot find symbol newKiller = oldKiller; ^ symbol: variable oldKiller location: class PlayerAssistant src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1341: error: variable o is already defined in method applyDead() Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId]; ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 8 errors Press any key to continue . . .
